chart_description: This chart monitors the number of calls for the fsync(2) and fdatasync(2) functions, which are used to synchronize changes to a file system. This can help identify potential performance bottlenecks or issues with data consistency.

dimension_descriptions.fdatasync: The number of fdatasync(2) calls per second. This function synchronizes the current state of the file with the device, without flushing the associated metadata.
dimension_descriptions.fsync: The number of fsync(2) calls per second. This function synchronizes both file data and metadata with the underlying device.
